did.unittitle: Virginia Outdoors Pamphlet and Clippings Collection , 1917-1979
did.physloc: Locked in compact shelving, Level 1, Shelf 30F.
did.abstract: This collection contains information on Virginia's water supply, springs, dams, and forestry services. The material was collected up through the 1970s in vertical file folders in McConnell Library. More details can be found in the finding aid.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: An appointment for research is required. The collection is open for research. No interlibrary loan.

acqinfo.p: Collected in vertical file folders in McConnell Library

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing and finding aid by Sarah Theibert with finding aid assistance by Gene Hyde.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains information on Virginia's water supply, springs, dams, and forestry services. The material was collected up through the 1970s in vertical file folders in McConnell Library.

Folders 1-8 contain pamphlets, projects, reports, studies on water pollution, news articles on populations impacted by an unclean water supply, and committees and groups that are concerned about the state of Virginia's water supply.
Folders 9 and 10 contain pamphlets and news articles about the springs their historical significance.
Folders 11-15 contain information on the dams in Virginia in the form of a project brochure, reports, final environmental impact statement, and pamphlets about water power.

Folders 16-23 contain bulletins from Virginia Polytechnic Institute, Virginia Forest Service, and the Office of the State Forester. There are also forest maps and pamphlets from George Washington and Jefferson National Forest.

blockquote.p: Folder 4: National Committee for the New River
Folder 6: Virginia Environmental Annual Report 1977 and 1979
Folder 9: VA Springs Pamphlets and Letter
Folder 13: Federal Power Commission Bureau of Power 1973
Folder 16: Office of the State Forester
